abstract: Check whether a device supports 3D Touch before enabling features that use it.
overview:
## Overview

To determine if 3D Touch is available on a device, check the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITraitCollection/forceTouchCapability] property of any object — such as your app’s views and view controllers — that adopts the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITraitEnvironment] protocol. The following code shows how you might use this property to enable or disable features at load time from your view controller. Use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITraitEnvironment/traitCollectionDidChange(_:)] method to detect changes to 3D Touch availability while your app is running.

For guidance on how to implement your app both with and without 3D Touch support, see [https://developer.apple.com/ios/human-interface-guidelines/].
title: Checking the availability of 3D Touch
